page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: BIRDS IN THE TALYBONT AREA Herons have been seen fishing along the rivers Leri and Ceulan. Woodpigeons,Blue tits,Great tits and Pied Flycatchers nest regularly round the village. Jackdaws and House sparrows are very common as well as Robins which are here all the year round. In summer if you keep your eyes open you can sometimes see Red Kites which are very rare,the other birds of prey found in the area are the Buzzard,Kestrel and sometimes Sparrowhawks are seen.Greenfinches, Chaffinches and Blackbirds are common in the area. In winter we get plenty of Redwings,Fieldfares,gulls and sometimes even Siskins and Bramblings. Near Talybont is a bog called Cors Fochno which is rich in bird life.
